metadata.title: USN-5587-1 -- curl vulnerability
metadata.description: Axel Chong discovered that when curl accepted and sent back cookies containing control bytes that a HTTP(S) server might return a 400 (Bad Request Error) response. A malicious cookie host could possibly use this to cause denial-of-service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5587-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libcurl4-gnutls-dev - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm12 libcurl4-openssl-dev - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm12 libcurl3-gnutls - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm12 libcurl4-doc - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm12 libcurl3-nss - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm12 libcurl4-nss-dev - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm12 libcurl3 - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm12 curl - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm12 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
